item.title: Help would be appreciated
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

package server.model.players;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.Player;

public class WaterContainers {
	private final Client c;
	private final int Cans[]={5331, 5333,15334,5335,5336, 5337,5338, 5339};
	private final int empty = 5331, a1 = 5333, a2 = 15334, a3 = 5335, a4 = 5336, a5 = 5337, a6 = 5338, a7 = 5339, a8 = 5340;//watering can with water in it.
	private final int MAGIC_CAN = 18682;
	public WaterContainers(final Client c) {
		this.c = c;	
	}
	public void addWater(){
		if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a7,1))
			c.getItems().deleteItem(a7, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a8), 1);
		else 
			if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a6,1))
				c.getItems().deleteItem(a6, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a7), 1);
			else
				if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a5,1))
					c.getItems().deleteItem(a5, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a6), 1);
				else
					if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a4,1))
						c.getItems().deleteItem(a4, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a5), 1);
					else
						if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a3,1))
							c.getItems().deleteItem(a3, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a4), 1);
						else
							if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a2,1))
								c.getItems().deleteItem(a2, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a3), 1);
							else
								if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(a1,1))
									c.getItems().deleteItem(a1, c.getItems().getItemSlot(a2), 1);
	}
	public void fillCan() {
		for (int i = 0; i < Cans.length; i++)
			if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(Cans[i])) {
				c.getItems().deleteItem(Cans[i], c.getItems().getItemSlot(a8), 1);
				c.sendMessage("You fill the can with water from the sink.");
			}	


	}
}

I’m not so good at making things work like they’re supposed to if that isn’t obvious.
What i’m basically try to do is…
If the player has any of the watering can id’s in the array “can”
it fills it with water deletes the can they had and replaces it with the int "a8"Which is a full watering can.
Ignore the method addWater, I’m probably going to get rid of that.
And if it makes a difference, I have a getter and setter set in client.java
this is what I have in useItem

			case 874:
			c.getWater().fillCan();
			break;

If someone could…
Maybe give an example on how to do something like this.
Or even explain what im doing wrong.
any help is appreciated.

Read full topic
